splash.content: Hello, I am apprentice web developer John Dulaney and welcome to my site! I say apprentice because I am currently enrolled in a full stack front end web development course at the Nashville Software School. This site is a representation of skills I have learned/am learning, as well as a project we are require to keep up with.

A short little bio: I was born November 22nd, 1988 in Knoxville Tennessee and have been living between East and middle TN my whole life, save the 5 years I attended a military academy in Missouri (Wentworth Military Academy). I graduated and Commissioned as an officer in the National Guard from there and soon attended the University of Missouri where a car accident ended my Army career and left me in a wheelchair. I have since returned to the Nashville area and attend NSS with high hopes on becoming a competent and successful web developer.

myBlog.title: Hump Day 4
myBlog.author: John Dulaney
myBlog.content: Last week of the month. Steve still throwing knowledge at us like a mad man. Immense Back pain from sitting upright and still all day. I want to lay on a couch and code. Basketball practice tonight, I'm going. I took 7 years off to rest and jack around, I have the energy. Need the workout anyway.

myBlog.title: Piles upon Piles
myBlog.author: John Dulaney
myBlog.content: Would have written yesterday but wayyyyy too much work. The worst part is knowing that you spend 30-40 minutes just getting a line or two completed rather than pages of working code. Really spinning my wheels on quite a few concepts. It's all on me as far as practice and attention to detail go i guess. Primus concert tonight, so tired and full of back pain might not go.

myBlog.title: Reindeer Games
myBlog.author: John Dulaney
myBlog.content: Stayed up till 1 am last night working on some exercises. Would have been in bed at 9:30 if Steve hadnt have slacked me about my incomplete exercises. I'm still afraid I'm not picking this stuff up as quick as some of my peers. Reindeer Exercise looming and I dont know where to start. Bright side is I knocked out some CSS ex in like an hour. Very tired, ready for the weekend!

myBlog.title: Pagination Nation
myBlog.author: John Dulaney
myBlog.content: Today we tackled Some pretty crazy Javascript. We hit generator functions as well as the Steve way of making a paginator, which is pretty insane. It's crazy the amount of work and code it takes to make some stupid buttons iterate through pages of conent, grey out at the right times, as well as do this all with buttons. I learned alot, but pulled most my code from a previous project. I'm not where I need to be ijn this class yet.

myBlog.title: Hump day 3
myBlog.author: John Dulaney
myBlog.content: Long time no post. Spent last week working with 2 different groups on 2 different websites. I learned quite alot, especially that I need to catch up to some people in terms of JS knowledge. Some people I worked with had outstanding knowledge and they should be proud of their current progress. No basketball tonight, but I for sure am going for a long push, 6 mile route, game chair?

myBlog.title: Tuesdays baby.
myBlog.author: John Dulaney
myBlog.content: Tuesdays are fun. Finally did an exercise right!!

myBlog.title: Looks like someone's got a case of the mondays
myBlog.author: John Dulaney
myBlog.content: CSS Selector practice with a side of tears. WHY ISNT IT CHANGING COLOR!??!

myBlog.title: We Made It!!!!
myBlog.author: John Dulaney

myProjects.name: Website
myProjects.description: This website you are currently on is one of my starting projects at Nashville Software School. It will continue to grow as my knowledge of programming expands. I intend to keep this bad boy updated.

myProjects.name: Class Work
myProjects.description: These are a few exercises assigned by NSS instructors to help use practice certain skills. Paired with the team oriented website building practice, I am developing a great working knowledge of the industry.

myProjects.name: Nutshell
myProjects.description: Nutshell is a psuedo social media single page app. It provided the user the ability to create tasks, add events, share news, and message other users(so long as they were on localhost.
myProjects.teammates: Chase Steely, Max Wolf, and Paul Ellis

myProjects.name: Capstone
myProjects.description: We are 100% on the demands of this project yet, but we have seen our sister cohorts examples. Something along the lines of our own Application! Sounds fun.

resume.title: Private, Cadet, Platoon Leader
resume.responsibilities: Ensure my platoon of 36 men were as lethal as possible and that all the needs of my commanders were met

resume.title: Stay at home son/student
resume.responsibilities: Keep the house clean and make life easy for elderly parents/recover from broken back/go to school
